detectors.description:
ERC20._transfer(address,address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#61-68) can write the state variable array at will
	Dangerous write operations:
	- _balances[sender] = _balances[sender].sub(amount,ERC20: transfer amount exceeds balance) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#65)
	- _balances[recipient] = _balances[recipient].add(amount) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#66)

	- [_balances[recipient] = _balances[recipient].add(amount)](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#L66)

detectors.description:
EDC (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#151-186) inherits the contract, there is a conflict between state variables and functions
	Conflicting functions and state variables:
	- IERC20.totalSupply() (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#4)
	- ERC20.transfer(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#37-40)
	- ERC20.transferFrom(address,address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#48-52)
	- ERC20.balanceOf(address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#34-36)
	- ERC20.approve(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#44-47)
	- ERC20.totalSupply() (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#31-33)
	- IERC20.transfer(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#6)
	- IERC20.transferFrom(address,address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#9)
	- IERC20.approve(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#8)
	- IERC20.allowance(address,address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#7)
	- IERC20.balanceOf(address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#5)
	- ERC20.allowance(address,address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/EDC.sol#41-43)
